授業方法:
Session 1 will be held face-to-face. Session 2 and onwards will be held simultaneously via Zoom through a two-way online broadcast. Please stand by in Zoom at least 5 minutes before the class starts. In addition to teacher instruction, students will work independently, with partners, in small groups and in whole class activities to practice and develop IELTS exam skills.

(Information ONLY for students permitted to take classes online: Where necessary and only for students permitted to take classes online the university will provide the means to participate in the classes on the day and time scheduled simultaneously via Zoom through a two-way online broadcast.)

第2回: Reading Introduction + Homework Assignments + Writing – Part 1 – Diagrams – Maps and Comparison of Plans
第3回: Listening - Recording 1 – a conversation between two people set in an everyday social context + Recording 2 – a monologue set in an everyday social context, e.g. a speech about local facilities
第4回: Writing – Part 1 – Graphs – Line and Bar
第7回: Listening – Recording 3 – a conversation between up to four people set in an educational or training context, e.g. a university tutor and a student discussing an assignment.
第8回: Writing – Part 1 – Pie Charts and Tables (Numerical Data)
第10回: Listening – Recording 4 - a monologue on an academic subject, e.g. a university lecture.
第14回: Writing – Part 2: Opinion Reviewed + Review of the IELTS test
トピック.授業外学習2: Review each lesson and complete the regular homework assignments in order to be prepared for the following class.  This should take between one to two hours per class lesson.
